title: Chedworth Roman Villa Walking Route

images.title: Sarah Charlesworth / Unexcavated lower field at Chedworth Roman villa
images.caption: Unexcavated lower field at Chedworth Roman villa

images.title: kitmasterbloke, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The North Bath House mosaic

images.title: Graham Horn / Former railway bridge in Chedworth Woods
images.caption: Former railway bridge in Chedworth Woods. This bridge carried the former railway line from Cirencester to Cheltenham. There is also an old tunnel in the woods.

images.title: Graham Horn / Looking north to Chedworth Woods
images.caption: Looking north to Chedworth Woods. Leaving Chedworth Woods, a footpath climbs to another east-west ridge before dropping into Chedworth village. Looking north, views open up above the woodland.

images.title: Stuart Wilding / Coln Valley
images.caption: Coln Valley. View from the Roman Villa at Chedworth down towards the Coln valley.

description: This circular walk around the village of Chedworth visits the fascinating Chedworth Roman Villa and Chedworth Woods. The walk starts in Chedworth and follows the Macmillan Way long distance trail to the National Trust owned villa. Here you will find the ruins of a large, 4th century Romano-British villa complete with wonderful mosaics, bathhouses and latrines. You can also see costumed guides bring Roman history to life and join a free tour of the site. The walk then continues through the lovely Chedworth woods, returning to Chedworth on public footpaths. For much of the walk you are also surrounded by some beautiful Cotswolds countryside. If you'd like to continue your walking in the area then you could pick up the Macmillan Way or the Monarch's Way which both run through the area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head east from the site and you could visit the historic town of Northleach. There's the Escape to the Cotswolds visitor attraction in the old prison and a fine 17th century inn for refreshment in the town. For more walking ideas in the area see the Cotswolds Walks page.

display_address: Church Row, Chedworth, Cotswold, Gloucestershire, England, GL54 4AD, United Kingdom
